body: Hey @kevinoid I think this makes sense, thanks for raising the issue. @AWhetter let me know if you have a different opinion.

Makes sense to me too.
@PCManticore Is it possible to use the value of an option defined by another checker?
@AWhetter Yep, you can use `pylint.utils.get_global_option` for that, e.g. `get_global_option(self, "option-name", default=default_value)`

issue.title: Enforce docparams consistently when docstring is not present

repository.name: pylint
repository.description: It's not just a linter that annoys you!

issue.body:
<!--

Thank you for submitting a PR to pylint!

To ease the process of reviewing your PR, do make sure to complete the following boxes.

You can also read more about contributing to pylint in this document:
https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/blob/master/doc/development_guide/contribute.rst#repository
-->

## Steps

- [x] Add yourself to CONTRIBUTORS if you are a new contributor.
- [x] Add a ChangeLog entry describing what your PR does.
- [x] If it's a new feature or an important bug fix, add a What's New entry in `doc/whatsnew/<current release.rst>`.
- [x] Write a good description on what the PR does.

## Description

Docparams extension now respects the `no-docstring-rgx` and `docstring-min-length` config parameters.

## Type of Changes
<!-- Leave the corresponding lines for the applicable type of change: -->
|   | Type |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| ✓  | :bug: Bug fix  |

## Related Issue

<!--
If this PR fixes a particular issue, use the following to automatically close that issue
once this PR gets merged:

Closes #xxx
-->
Closes #2738

issue.title: False positive ``missing-return-doc`` when a function is not supposed to be documented

labels.name: False Positive 🦟
labels.description: A message is emitted but nothing is wrong with the code

labels.name: Needs PR
labels.description: This issue is accepted, sufficiently specified and now needs an implementation

repository.name: pylint
repository.description: It's not just a linter that annoys you!

issue.body:
Issue #2738 appears to persist on pylint 2.9.5 as well as 3.0.0-a4 (as retrieved using `pip install --upgrade [--pre] pylint` on this date). The merge request for that issue seems to imply this fix should have gone out with pylint 2.7.x.

Has something gone wrong here, or have I misunderstood the merge?

### Steps to reproduce

File to be analyzed:
```python
'''module docstring goes here'''

# this function doesn't require a docstring, because its name starts
# with an '_' (no-docstring-rgx):
def _function(some_arg: int) -> int:
    _ = some_arg
    return 0
```

rcfile:
```
[MASTER]
load-plugins=pylint.extensions.docparams

[PARAMETER DOCUMENTATION]
accept-no-param-doc=no
accept-no-return-doc=no
```

### Current behaviour

```
************* Module scrap
scrap.py:5:0: W9011: Missing return documentation (missing-return-doc)

------------------------------------------------------------------
Your code has been rated at 6.67/10 (previous run: 6.67/10, +0.00)
```
### Expected behavior
 
There should be no errors; `_function` requires no docstring and should therefore require no return documentation.

### pylint --version output

Result of `pylint --version` output:

```
pylint 3.0.0-a4
astroid 2.6.5
Python 3.8.3 (default, Jul  6 2020, 09:12:34)
[Clang 10.0.1 (clang-1001.0.46.4)]
```
